review:
I didn't want to go along with the hate train, but the train chose me.

[b]t;dr[/b] the latest update is underwhelming, awful balancing, horrible planned missions. You know, the classic Blizzard move of ruining their games by poor management, ideas, and planning.

[b]Alternatives to this game on Steam with multiplayer and multiple characters[/b]:
> Lego games [i](Cheap games, nostalgia and funny gags, has sales as good as Orange Box)[/i]
> Team Fortress 2 [i](Free and outlived Overwatch twice)[/i]
> Paladins [i](Free! Overall more fun, but drawbacks in visuals)[/i]

The rest of this review contains a rant of my insanity loosing it from this update.
Be warned that there will be spoilers (who you will probably not care at all)

[b]New character are as amazing and interesting as moldy bread left in the attic for years.[/b]
New character is meh and their healing powers are stupidly powerful! It's not the fun powerful or skillful, it's just stupidly bad. She uses basically a direct upgrade to the immortality field, giving you INSANE healing with NO LIMIT until you kill it with it's stupid amount of HP. Think of you having to kill a sneaky tracer hiding in the corner every 10 seconds, otherwise you'll NEVER do enough damage to kill someone when they are near that stupidly named healing pylon. Oh yeah, you'll also have to shoot around as if you are Ana or Widowmaker but you CANNOT use a scope or any kind of zoom in feature.

It's so hard to counter their stupid amounts of healing. Also, their main weapon heals too not just their healing pylon, fantastic! You think I've reached annoyance? Oh don't worry, because they FORCE YOU TO PLAY ARCADE FOR HER MISSIONS!! You'll have to play with 4 OR MORE of this stupid new character AT ONCE. Only chance you have if the other team is complete trash at the game and doesn't know to press a button to place down their pylon. Also, why did they have to model her face after an 11-year-old girl and put it on a 21-year-old body. I swear they copied/pasted the head model from a baby or child, then "tried" to age it up for this character release.

I would rather have them scrap the character all together so they have time to focus on the "PVE" story they released... speaking of which are ALSO AWFUL!!

[b]The "PVE" missions are underwhelming (surprise)[/b]
The "PVE" story mission (yes, singular mission) is a "spoopy" robotic/futuristic reskin of King's Row with random junk put on the map to make it look like "decoration" while having no idea what decoration is. For god sake there is a random disco room for ABSOLUTELY no reason other than a collectible challenge they added for no reason other than to waste time. The first time playing was alright, confused why Tracer is in this mission (you'll find out why this is important later).

First time playing was okay, won, defeated evil robots, yippee. For the challenges, you need to keep replaying the SAME EXACT mission over and over again to go through them, btw two of the challenges are impossible. There is one challenge where you got to stop a robot from stealing the battery, which you can't because a robot steals the battery through a forced cutscene. The other impossible challenge is having to complete the mission in Legendary.

Remember why I said Tracer in this mission is important? Oh good, because she is the WORST class for this mission. If your order in the player list in terms of damage isn't Torbjorn, Winston, Lucio, and THEN Tracer, you lost. No matter what the skill level is or the condition during the PVE mission, Tracer will always be bottom fragging for this PVE mission. Her lower damage and fumble body makes her an annoyance since you need to keep reviving them. They are lucky enough to be a respawn anchor, but that's it. You would think "oh Tracer must be some kind of scout who adventures out to get the batteries" well you're WRONG AND STUPID! When you pickup a battery, your movement abilities are LOCKED and your movement speed is decreased. This isn't much the case for the other 3 playable characters though, which is stupid.

So difficulties from 1 to 3 in the mission all have the same kind of difficulty in my opinion, 2 being the easier than 1 for some reason. But for option 4 in difficulty, I hope you learned how to play dark souls with no dodging while having your stomach digest food from a taco bell that was built next to a nuclear radiation plant. Characters one shot you, no change at dodging or expect their possible movement, when everyone dies you have to re-queue the ENTIRE mission instead of restarting at the last checkpoint.

[b]Finishing statements[/b]
Graphics are nice, the stories behind the characters are good, but the gameplay itself is awful. Most people will have a better experience watching someone else play than playing the game themselves. Just go back to playing TF2 servers as you wait for Blizzard's management and execs figure it out, aka get replaced by competent ones.

Better yet, spend your money on Lego games on steam. They are stupid cheap, most of them on sale you can get it for like 50 cents a game, and there are tons of play ability in that than this mess of a game.

Bobby Kotik is greasy and deserves to bang his chins on a rusty chainsaw in what ever circle of hell he's going to end up in.

I forgot how much I disliked this game. Its also funny how they added features like "on fire" which was on overwatch 1 and has dialogue for overwatch 2 but not added till a recent update. These guys don't listen to the community. Completely underwhelming game-play also did I mention still no lootbox which used to be free? I won't be surprised if they added it back but i doubt it since that would bring back some fans but that is not their goal. I feel like their goal is to piss everyone off, have everyone blame the devs, underdevelop the game, not deliver player expectation and charge cosmetics for $20 to $40. Blizzards target audience are Fortnite players: if you're trying to be like Fortnite at least try to do it like Fortnite. The rewards for the battle pass is terrible and the fact that new characters are only unlockable through the battle pass, which you cannot renew like Fortnite and other games that give you back premium currency. The whole point of having the sequel was for the PVE. Now  its just an overhaul of the first game with small enough changes to call it a "sequel". 

P.S. no sex, please add sex
